p: High-quality Sr 4(Ru 1−xMn x) 3O 10 single crystals were grown via the floating-zone technique. For making both feed and seed rods, polycrystalline Sr 4(Ru 1−xMn x) 3O 10 was first prepared by heating the mixture with the molar ratio SrCO 3: [(1 − x)Ru + xMnO 2] = 4: 3 up to 1400 °C for 24 h in oxygen atmosphere with quick cool off by quenching. It is then hydrostatically pressed into cylinder-shaped rods, and further sintered at 950 °C for another 12 h in oxygen atmosphere. Single crystals were grown through melting the feed rod and moving downward with the speed of 30 mm/h. To prevent oxygen deficiency, 0.9 MPa oxygen pressure was applied during the growth. In addition, both feed and seed rods were rotated in opposite directions at 20 rpm to improve homogeneity and reduce possible impurity.
